questions.question_text: This British mathematician laid the foundations of computer science, proposed the imitation game later known as the Turing Test, and played a crucial role in breaking the Enigma code during World War II.
questions.explanation: Alan Turing is widely regarded as a foundational figure in computer science and artificial intelligence, known for the Turing Test and his wartime cryptographic work.

questions.question_text: This computer scientist coined the term 'Artificial Intelligence' in 1956, created the Lisp programming language, and was instrumental in organizing the Dartmouth Conference.
questions.explanation: John McCarthy introduced the term 'Artificial Intelligence' and developed Lisp, a language that became central to early AI research.

questions.question_text: A co-founder of MIT's AI Lab, this pioneer emphasized symbolic AI and human-level intelligence, and was an early advocate for studying the mind as a computational system.
questions.explanation: Marvin Minsky was a key figure in early AI, known for symbolic approaches and for co-founding the MIT AI Laboratory.

questions.question_text: This researcher, often called one of the 'Godfathers of Deep Learning', helped popularize backpropagation and previously led AI research at Google Brain.
questions.explanation: Geoffrey Hinton is renowned for his contributions to neural networks and backpropagation and for his leadership at Google Brain.

questions.question_text: This British AI researcher and entrepreneur co-founded DeepMind, led the development of AlphaGo, and later became CEO of the company after its acquisition by Google.
questions.explanation: Demis Hassabis is the co-founder and CEO of DeepMind, best known for leading the AlphaGo project.

questions.question_text: This AI educator and entrepreneur founded Google Brain, later led AI efforts at Baidu, and is widely known for making machine learning accessible through online courses.
questions.explanation: Andrew Ng is known for founding Google Brain, leading Baidu AI, and popularizing AI education worldwide.

questions.question_text: This AI ethics researcher gained global attention after co-authoring a paper on the risks of large language models and later co-founded the Distributed AI Research Institute (DAIR).
questions.explanation: Timnit Gebru is a prominent AI ethics researcher and co-founder of DAIR, known for her work on bias and accountability in AI systems.

questions.question_text: This computer vision expert led the ImageNet project, served as Chief Scientist of AI/ML at Google Cloud, and is a strong advocate for human-centered AI.
questions.explanation: Fei-Fei Li is best known for leading the ImageNet project and for her leadership in human-centered AI initiatives.

questions.question_text: This researcher co-founded OpenAI, made key contributions to deep learning optimization, and later became Chief Scientist at the organization.
questions.explanation: Ilya Sutskever is a co-founder and Chief Scientist of OpenAI, known for influential work in deep learning.

questions.question_text: This tech leader became a prominent figure in AI as the CEO of OpenAI, focusing on the deployment and governance of large-scale generative models.
questions.explanation: Sam Altman is the CEO of OpenAI and is known for guiding the organization's work on large-scale AI systems and policy discussions.
